page.title: 10A Gretton farmer's life
page.content: Geoffrey Paul Hunt lives at 6,Corby Rd. Gretton,with his wife and two sons Graham and Richard. He rents 600 acres of land altogether and keeps animals such as cows and sheep. He starts his work at 7.30 a.m. and gets the cows in. In Spring he goes lambing and is out all day up to midnight.He has a combine harvester,5 tractors-2 four-wheel drive and 3 two-wheel drive,muckspreaders and a potato harvester. His is a mixed farm and he was taught by his father who used to run the farm. At harvest time he starts work at 7.00 but if there is dew on the ground he cannot start until 9.00. Mr Hunt takes the animals to Kettering market to sell.He has about 50 fields,the largest 30 acres and the smallest 2.Mr Hunt is worried that most of the grain he grows will be stored away due to national over-production, while people in the 3rd world starve.
